Linguistic analysis: The expert may have analyzed the language used in the claim to determine if it matches the typical style and vocabulary of the person or entity being accused.
Contextual analysis: The expert may have examined the context in which the claim was made, including any relevant events or statements, to assess the likelihood of its authenticity.
Source verification: The expert may have investigated the original source of the claim to verify its authenticity and determine if it was attributed correctly.
Fact: checking: The expert may have fact-checked the claim by comparing it to available evidence and information to determine its accuracy and validity.
